content: On July 17, 1999, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the New York Mets at Turner Field, where they celebrated the 20th anniversary of the franchise's move to Atlanta. In a thrilling game, Braves' ace Greg Maddux pitched a stellar outing, leading the team to a 5-1 victory. This win helped the Braves extend their lead in the National League East during a season that ultimately saw them reach the postseason for the 10th consecutive year. Maddux's performance was a reminder of his dominance during the late '90s and solidified his legacy as one of the game's great pitchers.
